In the year that produced The Avengers for me the best comic book based film to date this catastrophe of a film is not that much important. Because Spidey has been captured tons better before. The first Hulk was imho the worst comic book film - then i watched this "gem". Thank God it got redeemed in the next one. What's especially concerning and troubling is that they're planning to turn this into a franchise according to imdb. What I can honestly say is that I felt ripped off. Yeah I just downloaded the torrent and didn't pay a dime for the cinema - probably because i could smell the crap from a distance - but still i feel ripped off. Probably because some bozos where placed to make a film reboot on an iconic comic book hero, they fucked up quite a lot in the process, said "ehh whatever dude" along the way and this insulting piece of crap came out of it.

Thx

@useitright Number one: this isn't a remake. It's a reboot... they are two vastly different concepts. A remake is telling the same story again while a reboot tells a new story with many of the same characters and setting. And after the shitfest that was Spider-Man 3 a reboot was definitely needed.
Secondly: Not producing webs isn't "bullshit". What is "bullshit" is having Spider-Man produce web organically. Seriously, if you have ever even glanced at a Spider-Man comic you should know that his (or at least the main, prime universe Spider-Man) webs have always come from Peter's own hand made shooters and not from his body.
